channel.title: History on stultus notes
channel.description: Recent content in History on stultus notes

item.title: Chinese Settlement in Calicut
item.description: Thousands of Chinese soldiers lived in Calicut during the Ming dynasty, leaving behind a mixed Malayali-Chinese community called Chinna Kribala.

item.title: Legend of Prester John
item.description: A mythical Christian priest-king whom medieval Europeans believed ruled a fabulously rich and powerful Christian kingdom somewhere ‘in the East’.

item.title: The Ivory Throne by Manu S Pillai
item.description: A historical account of the Travancore royal family and the life of Sethu Lakshmi Bayi, the last Maharani Regent of Travancore.

item.title: Podcast Etymology
item.description: The word ‘podcast’ was coined by Ben Hammersley in February 2004 as a blend of ‘iPod’ and ‘broadcast’.

item.title: Primary Sources in Historical Research
item.description: The importance of primary sources - firsthand accounts from people who were actually there.

item.title: Petition Against Ayyankali - 1914
item.description: Historical petition from 1914 showing resistance faced by social reformer Ayyankali.
